channel.title: My runserver.bat is acting weird.!?
channel.description:
ok i accidently got locked yesertday for double posting (forgot and didnt know i did by accident i wont do again.) and this is my problem. :
ok my server will run for like atleast 20 minutes, then it will randomly null... how do i fix it?
ok it turns out this is what it says. :
java.net.SocketException: Connection reset at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at client.fillInStream(client.java:7849) at client.run(client.java:16220) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (69.2.207.7)
how do i fix them now?

item.title: My runserver.bat is acting weird.!?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:2, topic:256811”]java.net.SocketException: Connection reset

[quote]
It usually happens when the connection was reset by the peer – that is, when the client unexpectedly closed the socket. This happens when the user clicks “close”, or “reload”, (before your server gets to close its socket). This is normal behavior and you shouldn’t worry about it.
[/quote][/quote]
That explains it perfectly. Problem solved.

Read full topic

item.title: My runserver.bat is acting weird.!?
item.dc:creator: @Mohit101 Mohit101
item.description:
@Mohit101 wrote:

I have the same error =\

item.title: My runserver.bat is acting weird.!?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

java.net.SocketException: Connection reset

It usually happens when the connection was reset by the peer -- that is, when the client unexpectedly closed the socket. This happens when the user clicks "close", or "reload", (before your server gets to close its socket). This is normal behavior and you shouldn't worry about it.

Read full topic
